name: Tanelia Matthews
text: Every single visit always results in me sitting for extended periods of time even with an established appointment time. I think that it’s highly inconsiderate to not respect the patients’ time. Patients are often told to reschedule if they are more than 15 minutes late. How about if you are not called back within 15 minutes of your scheduled appointment time, then patients reschedule for the office to receive their insurance/self-pay money??? There needs to be a better strategy to the scheduling of this facility, so that every patient receives the appropriate care while having their time respected, as well. Everyone does not have 3+ hours of time to sit and wait for a simple doctor’s appointment.

name: Lauren Grzegorczyk
text:
Currently sitting in the parking lot, waiting for a phone appointment with PA Tammie Smith so I can refill important medication. Over an hour and a half ago during my check in, I was told there were 2 people ahead of me. 45 minutes past my appointment time, I’m told there is still 1 person ahead of me. My appointment time was at 1:40, and it is now past 3pm with still no phone call. These phone conferences have never taken more than 5-10 minutes.

I’ve  been coming here for two years, and it’s been absolutely god awful. Never have I been to a Clinic that is this consistency unprofessional, doesn’t pick up the phone half the time, and can easily have you waiting to be seen for up to 2hours, sometimes more. Always severely understaffed as well, which makes me feel bad for the few employees there that are actually kind and decent. If it were not for sliding scale, I would never come back. If you have insurance, avoid this place at all costs. Seriously.

Update: Finally had my phone conference and PA Tammie Smith was rude per usual! Shouldn’t expect anything more from a doctor with multiple 1 star reviews on webmd though, right?

name: cesar ibarra
text: We love our pediatrician at Huntsville Family Health Center.  Dr. Xavier is very thorough and has gone the extra mile when caring for my child- time and time again.  I feel at ease putting the care of my child in Dr. Xavier's hands.  Dr. Xavier listens to me, addresses my concerns, and asks the right questions.  Overall, I'm very satisfied with him and will continue to see him for all of my pediatric needs.

resp.text: Hi Cesar, thank you for your review.  At Huntsville Family Health Center, we strive for excellence in caring for our patients.  We will relay the positive words you shared about Doctor Niraj Xavier with the team.  Thank you for continuing to make us your preferred choice!

name: Michelle Robison
text: Get to appt on time yet always have an hour or more wait before getting called to the back and then still sit in the room longer waiting for the Dr.

name: Chad Chaney
text: Very helpful everytime I go . My wifes diabetic meds costs almost $4000.00 everywhere and here it costs under 100.00

resp.text: Hello Mr. Chaney, thank you for your review about the helpfulness of our team at Huntsville Family Health Center.  We will certainly pass your comments along.

name: Tara Caputo
text: I love Dr. Kurecki and his office staff. He is easy to talk to and really listens! He has a lot of great advice, and I am not waiting 2 weeks to see him. He also has a very diverse background and a lot of medical knowledge. 10/10 recommend if you are looking for a family doc!

resp.text: Hi, Ms. Caputo. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us. We'll be sure to pass your comments along to our Huntsville Family Health Center team.

name: Sharon Murph
text: The NP was unfriendly, rushing and didn’t listen to my complaints. I want Dr. Lisabeth Williams back!!!

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Murph. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Please consider calling us at (855) 724-7325 so that we can directly address this. Thank you.

name: Nina Thomas
text: Joel is awesome I wish the rest of the staff was like him. He assisted us in ten minutes we had the results we’ve been trying to receive for 21 days no one ever answered the phone so we had to drive to the health center

resp.text: Hi Nina.  Thank you for your feedback.  It will be shared with our leadership team.

name: Sadie Lynch
text: Always a warm welcome doctor Williams is the best

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us here at Huntsville Family Health Center.  We will pass your comments along to our team!

name: Jeanette Torres
text: The dr don’t know what they doing. They don’t really pay attention to what you want to say. The place is not sanitized right.im very unhappy with everything.

resp.text: Hi Jeanette Torres.   It is disappointing to learn that your experience was not positive, and we would like to get more details.  Please reach out to Jalin at 256-533-6311.  Thank you again for taking the time to reach out to us, and we hope to hear from you soon.

name: Kelley Cornelius
text: This office was absolutely laughable. The worst experience I have ever had at a physician's office.  They scheduled an MRI I arrive at the appointment to be sent away due to the fact that this office did not have the correct orders written.  Reschedule for the following week and again incorrect orders.  Mind you the place where I was having the MRI done also called multiple times and even physically went to this office to try to get things done.  Finally have the MRI done and they had the results the next day and two weeks later still no phone call about the results after I have called multiple times, left messages for a return phone call multiple times.  Then today I get someone FINALLY live on the phone and this person could not even pronounce the medical terminology, I ask to speak with someone else and she transfers me to an extension where the mailbox is full and I can't leave a message.  Soooo frustrated and changing to a new TRICARE provider.

resp.text: Hi Kelley, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.  We are disappointed to hear of your negative experience with us.  Your review will be provided to our leadership team for addressing.  In the meantime, please call Jalin at 256-533-6311.  Thank you.

name: Madison Lowry
text: dr love does not listen and will talk over you. he is very rude and also likes to joke on you at your own expense. his nurses were phenomenal though and they’re the only reason HFHC isn’t getting 1 star.

resp.text: Hi Madison.  We are sorry to hear that you had a bad experience.  We will share your feedback with our leadership team.  In the meantime, please consider calling our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234.

name: Sherry Black
text:
I am pretty sure it depends on who your doctor is, but... I never have to wait long when I go to my doctor! Rather I have an appointment or they are working me in, it is NEVER a long wait!
Dr Kurecki is my doctor & I think highly of him! I am very confident putting my health in his hands!

name: Matt Nieves
text: If it wasn't for how nice the doctor was w me I would've said 0 staff is very not proffesional and rude, the lady in the laboratory thinks she can treat everybody however she wants which not very proffesional I would not recommend this place

resp.text: Hello Matt.  Thank you for bringing this matter up to our attention.   Although you had a positive interaction with the doctor, we are disappointed to learn of your entire experience.  Please call our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234 so that we can properly document your concern.  Thank you.

name: noella hall
text: My husband has been going to Dr Kurecki for some time now. He has always been at ease and all issues discussed, we absolutely love him.

name: Tea Raine
text: I went my first time and was happy to get help. Staff was nice and caring.

text: The staff on the first floor were amazing and very polite! On the second floor the nurse practitioner was rude, displayed unprofessional behavior and I will not be returning to this clinic!

name: Rebecca Louthan
text: The staff is very unprofessional and rude. I have never in my life been treated so poorly before.

text: My partner spent over $60 round trip to get help for his medical issues here, waited for over two hours, and then got told that there's nothing he could do about it. No referrals to any specialists, nothing. Don't go here unless you have no other choice.

Finally have the MRI done and they had the results the next day and two weeks later still no phone call about the results after I have called multiple times, left messages for a return phone call multiple times.  Then today I get someone FINALLY live on the phone and this person could not even pronounce the medical terminology, I ask to speak with someone else and she transfers me to an extension where the mailbox is full and I can't leave a message.  Soooo frustrated and changing to a new TRICARE provider.

resp.text: Hi Kelley, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.  We are disappointed to hear of your negative experience with us.  Your review will be provided to our leadership team for addressing.  In the meantime, please call Jalin at 256-533-6311.  Thank you.

name: Madison Lowry
text: dr love does not listen and will talk over you. he is very rude and also likes to joke on you at your own expense. his nurses were phenomenal though and they’re the only reason HFHC isn’t getting 1 star.

resp.text: Hi Madison.  We are sorry to hear that you had a bad experience.  We will share your feedback with our leadership team.  In the meantime, please consider calling our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234.

name: Sherry Black
text:
I am pretty sure it depends on who your doctor is, but... I never have to wait long when I go to my doctor! Rather I have an appointment or they are working me in, it is NEVER a long wait!
Dr Kurecki is my doctor & I think highly of him! I am very confident putting my health in his hands!

name: Matt Nieves
text: If it wasn't for how nice the doctor was w me I would've said 0 staff is very not proffesional and rude, the lady in the laboratory thinks she can treat everybody however she wants which not very proffesional I would not recommend this place

resp.text: Hello Matt.  Thank you for bringing this matter up to our attention.   Although you had a positive interaction with the doctor, we are disappointed to learn of your entire experience.  Please call our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234 so that we can properly document your concern.  Thank you.

name: noella hall
text: My husband has been going to Dr Kurecki for some time now. He has always been at ease and all issues discussed, we absolutely love him.

name: Tea Raine
text: I went my first time and was happy to get help. Staff was nice and caring.

name: Cheria Moore
text: The staff on the first floor were amazing and very polite! On the second floor the nurse practitioner was rude, displayed unprofessional behavior and I will not be returning to this clinic!

name: Rebecca Louthan
text: The staff is very unprofessional and rude. I have never in my life been treated so poorly before.

name: Airi Ventura
text: My partner spent over $60 round trip to get help for his medical issues here, waited for over two hours, and then got told that there's nothing he could do about it. No referrals to any specialists, nothing. Don't go here unless you have no other choice.

name: Deanna Resler
text: Best I've had in a long time really cared and got me the right refferal needed for my gallbladder surgery I will defaintly be back for future sickness

name: Javon Green
text: Worst doctors office I've ever been to PLEASE DO DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME I had a appointment at 1pm waited two hrs! Still didn't see the doctor if I could give it a negative star I would

text:
Waited over 2 hours. I've never seen the Dr. It's always his nurse. Tried to call his answering service to cancel my appointment and the lady said she didn't even have my Dr's name in her computer.
Trust me when I say go somewhere else.

name: Latasha Rodgers
text: Got to the front door yeah

name: Anita McLamb (McLamb Group Media)
text: My life will forever be changed by Tashara! She has an uncanny ability to listen instinctively without judgment as well as ask the questions to find the lost memories in your mind.  Therapy has made me feel whole again. I didn't know how to move forward until I met her. If you are looking for answers in life and don't know where to turn give her office a call and schedule and appointment. This is the best decision I have ever made for my life and my family.

name: Veronica Suggs
text: My family is blessed to have found Tashara. What started out as counseling for my 8 year turned into me becoming a patient and dealing with my own mental trauma. She has been a sounding board and someone I can trust to help. I didn’t know for sure if therapy would help me because I thought my issues ran too deep to fix. I didn’t think it would make a difference at this stage in my life but my weekly meetings with Tashara has been a lifeline. She is sweet, empathetic, and helpful. I never would’ve imagined counseling would be as effective as it’s been. I’m truly thankful

name: Jonai McCoy
text: As a Social Worker, I am particular when choosing a therapist. I’ve had two therapist prior to Tashara and I hate it took me sooo long to find her! I appreciate her honesty and level of questioning that forces me to think deeply and see things differently. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Art Of Valor
text: A great service and resource to Piedmont and nearby communities.

name: Christina Oates
text: Thrive is making such an impact in my life. I love how easy and open the conversations are and how the counselors personalize the “growth” assignments to their clients. They honestly meet you were you are and are honest and helpful about where the next steps are and how to take them on your journey to a better and healthier you.

name: Carly Steed
text: Please do not book a psychiatry appointment here. I was diagnosed with a panic disorder (after being asked vague questions and made to feel uncomfortable) and prescribed a VERY outdated medicine that isn’t prescribed anymore. After speaking to my therapist about not feeling anything, and even feeling worse from the medicine prescribed, I called the office and was immediately told that I could only talk to the psychiatrist in person and would have to pay for another session rather than quickly speak to the psychiatrist about this weird medicine or ask any questions. The psychiatrist would not take questions over the phone. I went to another psychiatrist, and was told that the medicine I was prescribed was one that she had never heard of. Please take the plunge and join the waiting list to see another psychiatrist.

resp.text: While we do stand behind the knowledge and expertise of our psychiatrist, your experience following up was not acceptable. It will be addressed and we apologize for your experience. If you would like to discuss it directly you can reach me on my cell at (205) 743-9251.

name: Sarah Arnold
text: Wonderful counselors who will really listen and do their best to help you.

name: Sam Mayhew
text: Great counciling for all of your mental health needs.

name: Burgandy M
text: Did not want to retain me as a patient. Counselor cancelled appointments. Phone sessions were cut short (counselor disinterested).

resp.text: We never want one of our clients to feel this way. You can contact me directly on my cell at (205) 743-9251 and we will do whatever we need to to make this right.

name: kyle fortenberry
text: The best counsellors work here!

name: Scott Hodnett
text: Wonderful place with great counselors!!

name: Payton H. Stantis
text: When I say that Thrive Counseling & Trauma Therapy has saved my life, I mean THEY HAVE SAVED MY LIFE. The methods that Jeff and his team use to help their clients are different than any type of therapy I have experienced. I spent much of my life seeing talk therapists who would make me feel heard, but that never gave me the tools to handle life's difficult situations. Thrive will hear you and help you figure out concrete ways to handle life's hurdles while providing you with the tools necessary to regulate yourself in any situation. I have been going here for years and have made significant progress on managing emotions, conflict resolution, self esteem, and have processed through multiple traumas. Many of my friends and family go here as well and we are all constantly singing their praises!  If you are ready for some healing contact these wonderful humans because they are the best in the biz! Good luck!<3

name: JustBeingDrè _
text: I have known Jeff professionally for years. We worked side by side, practically sharing an office for about 2 years. He is truly passionate about his work and the healing of his clients. I know for a fact that he will go the extra mile to help clients achieve therapeutic goals, if you are willing to do your part. He is experienced and certified in substance abuse treatment and trauma therapy.

name: Regina Turner
text: Jeff has been helpful as I work through adjustments and anxiety.

name: Theresa Rose
text: I never thought I could get better and not be depressed, until I started seeing Jeff at Thrive a few years ago. The day he was getting married, I had a pretty terrible panic attack and called him, and he spoke with me for 45 minutes and was able to calm me down. Right before they walked down the aisle!!! EMDR helped even though I was skeptical of it. I’m not perfect now, but I’m far from the sad, depressed girl who walked into Thrive suicidal all those years ago. They are wonderful and I couldn’t sing their praises enough!!!

name: Mellissa Goetz
text: Great counseling! Not just someone that will just listen and give metaphors. Actually getting better with each visit. Would highly recommend!

name: john hulstrunk
text: If you want problems completely ignored by staff come here. If I could give zero stars I would.

name: Holly Walker
text: This counselor is amazing. She was very helpful!! Really appreciate all of her help!

name: Kadie Oquain
text: A very friendly place nice people too

name: Genoc Genesis
text: I see Maggie Kellar and her nurse Mackenzie. They are both fantastic and very personable. I drive 45 minutes just to see them specifically. My experience with Mrs.Kellar is the best doctor/patient experience I have ever had. As long as the both of them are there I will always come back.

resp.text:
We appreciate the five-star review. Thank you for taking the time. I share this with the team!
Kindly,
April

name: melody galloway

resp.text:

Kindly,
April

resp.text:
So glad you had a great experience, Paula. I will share your feedback and praise with our team. Have a wonderful day!
April

name: Gail GULF SHORES
text: So far so good for the excellent help I've got online with KATHERINE DAVIS. She is a very compassionate employee,  "goes the extra mile ". So helpful with any questions.  A keeper.

resp.text:
Hi, Gail! Thank you for the five-star review. We appreciate your kind words.
Sincerely,
April

name: Sandi Cushway
text: They completely changed my medications that I have been stable on for over 15 years (with not ever having to increase ANYTHING).  I have only seen the PA twice and she was pretty nice.  There seems to be little concern for what I, as their patient, am going through every single day as a result of their decisions.  They are making matters worse for me mentally to where I am barely functional at home or work.  The only reason I gave two stars is for the nurse, Anita.

resp.text:
Sandi, I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations. Your feedback will help us improve our services. If there is anything further you wish to add you can reach a member of our patient relations department at info@altapointe.org.

April

text: They have an issue with making sure their records are up to date. Their staff isn’t helpful and I’m not sure they could be even if they wanted to. Lots of “Its not my problem” going on there. resp.text:
Hi, Serena Kay. Thank you for the five-star review. We appreciate you and your feedback.
Sincerely,
April

text: First of all it took 3 months to get in to see a nurse practitioner to try to get different medication for my anxiety. So I spent an hour there waiting just to hear I'm the plague basically. I've never felt so offended. I already cant go to my own brothers wedding because of it but now this. I'm furious.

April

April

text: If I could give a zero star review I would. If you want an incompetent doctor that will try and overdose you than this is the place for you. Dr. Holloway would not let us get a word in wise and said there was nothing wrong with the dosage or medication. Mind you he prescribe a 100mg trazodone for her which is one of the highest doses on the market. Steer clear of there and this unprofessional, incompetent doctor who should have his medical license revoked.

name: David Bussey
text: Its laughable how bad the program is. Appointments are always cancelled, the office staff couldn’t care less about you, incompetence runs rampant, turnover is constant and rude on the phone. Henry E. Parker
Executive Director

name: Wendy Adams
text: Unprofessional staff. They act like they only care for themselves and not the patient. Would not recommend to anyone

name: Neq H
text: Ms. Jackson is very personable and down to earth. She is a great listener and I feel I really gained some understanding after seeing her. I highly recommend her services!!

name: candice keller
text: Mrs. Jackson is the most caring individual I've ever met. She is very attentive to my needs and offers clear and helpful advice. I've become more successful in my journey for healness from my past.

name: Ilya Brunshteyn
text: The staff is generally very professional and nice. We have had some disagreements but for the most part they are just doing their job. I enjoy the groups and the instructors as well as the classes. There seems to be a little bias as to when and why people get drug tested but for good reason. Romulan, Alicia and Angela have been nothing but good and understanding with me. I disagree with not being able to drink alcohol but they consider it a substance and are just doing their job.

name: Randy Nelson
text: Allicia, is my counsuler,and romalin they are very deticated to there work and love us!!!!

name: nina hunt
text: Worst place ever...that DR Mandy never calls in my meds to the drug store she doesn't listen to you and only wants to talk about herself...

This is the worst place to for help. They rude and obnoxious.  They treat people like dirt to be walked on. Scare them in to believing things that just are not true in order to control them. Because the staff that is there now is far from having principals morals and a solid education and background in the mental health treatments and care. The good employees never last long there...They leave quickly. They realize how horrible that place really is. Clients need to be treated with respect not degradation.

hateful. All their to do is get a check. They should fire the whole staff and get compentwell educated people

name: Michael Serpa
text: Rude and disrespectful. They don't care about you only the money.

name: tlisx
text: Probably wouldn't be near as bad if it wasn't for the main office of the place having problems with how phones work. I like my therapist and the help I receive, but it's hard when the ladies in building one don't seem to care much about anything. You can't get ANYONE to answer the phone, so if you need to reschedule anything, good damn luck. I guess I'll have to go up in person, AGAIN. I already have enough going on in my life, that's why I go here, and I shouldn't have to go out of my way to be certain that the people supposed to help me actually are.

name: Stephen Wisener
text: With all the 1 star reviews I guess they are not accepting new clients. I'm so thankful for Google reviews, it saved the middle class tons of money. My motto for reviews is..... it's 4 or more before I walk through the door. 👍

name: Hannah Kayy
text: Misdiagnosed here they tried telling me that I had schizophrenia and bipolar they put me on a number of medications so much that I couldn’t function thanks to them I will never get back what I lost in life.. they are very unprofessional and rude they do not care about you they care about the money they bring in worst excuse for a mental health facility.

name: Telina Bates
text: I find that the psychiatrists and nurse practioners are helpful. I don't find, however, the therapists to be beneficial and really help you identify the root of your problems. I can also never reach anyone on the phone. Usually I have to go up there or send my husband up there. If I leave a message, 9 times out of 10, they will not return your call.

name: Matt Shockley
text: I don't even know where to begin.  If you are mentally I'll and trying to find treatment, this is NOT the place to go.

name: Ron Farmer
text: Needed help with a few things in my life and all I got was no,no,no and we can't do that said I had an appointment last January wasn't even living in Alabama then. There is no help in Alabama period unless you are doing drugs can't wait to leave

text: This place is the most unprofessional place I have had the displeasure of dealing with in my life. This is the only psychiatrist help I can find in Cullman. text: Mandy is actually terrible. Never switched psychs faster.

name: Hannah Hendon
text: Honestly....im not sure how some "professionals" here got passed their undergrad.

name: Jeff king
text: ROMALYN has helped me tremendosley

name: Hannah Goodson

name: Gail Rutledge Washington

name: Oneofakind
text: I wouldn't recommend. From different people and from personal experience with them. Some people are definitely worse off when they leave. Just look around if you go to where they treat mental health patients some are walking around like zombies others look like they are still looking for someone to help them.

name: mlau
text:
My relative was referred to this group from UAB Psychiatric following a mental breakdown after the suicide of her husband. After working with the social worker at UAB, I tried to get into contact with ANYONE at JBS and could not. Called multiple times and emailed and never got a response. I have power of attorney for her and legally can have access to her medical and financial information, and have been trying to help her get back on her feet.
For the first month, my relative didn't know who her case manager was or what her treatment plan was. My relative did not receive any individual therapy there. The group home she was placed in had fights and screaming regularly and also was infested with bedbugs. They also tried to move her to another group home that scared her more than where she was, but never did. Just not a lot of consistency. She also said she was talked to like a problem rather than a person. Staff told her that the group home residents had been exposed to Covid, but no one received testing. I have no contact number or email for anyone working closely with my relative to talk about future plans or treatment.

name: Rosalind Lewis
text: The referral from a doctor for mental health care and payment based on income. Jefferson, Blount and Shelby county residents must give a zip code for residence to obtain appointment at nearest therapy clinic. They show all it; they have these offices in these countries.

name: Liz Harding
text: I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews for this agency. I suppose it's due to the fact that they do work with a lot of children and families that were referred because of involvement with the law, DHR, or because they are indigent and in need of mental health services. We have been working with project FIND and children's services It has been amazing. My son has turned back into the gentleman he was before adolescence set in. I cannot sing the therapists praises enough.

name: Shea Stevenson
text: Warning: if you are suicidal or having problems DO NOT CALL THEM. The woman who answered the phone today will make you want to die more. Rudest phone call I have ever been on in my life. I'm trying to save someone's life and they were of zero help. Look elsewhere.

name: Terry Teague
text: Champ employer.

name: Crystal Channell
text: Horrible agency

name: Haley Davis
text: I went to see Dr. Bodiford for help with my ADHD and instead I was told I'm "too smart" to have ADHD via an IQ test, and I must only have dyscalculia instead. After going to another psychiatrist for a second opinion, I was told I absolutely have ADHD and that IQ tests are not at all a way to determine if a patient has ADHD. I went three years before seeking this second opinion, and in those three years I have struggled with my ADHD more than ever. I am so thankful for the ADHD Clinic in Hoover because Alabama Psychiatry failed me.

resp.text: We apologise if your expectations were not met.  Would you like to speak with the office manager?

name: Lea Roberts
text: Jacob Scott was very kind to me at a time when I needed help.   Covid caused a change in how they delivered care, but it was seemless.   Leigh Ann has been so helpful.   It is a humbling experience to need help...but they never look down on you and truly care about their patients.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.

name: Chason Burdick
text: Great doctors i really have come a long way with their help they are very caring and careful  love my dr Jacob Scott hes helped me more than he knows I did leave a review that was i thought confidential listing only one issue I had then I got a termination of care letter  I love Dr Scott hes helped me through alot and I pray in his heart that he will see that I really need him and his care more than he ever would know

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.

name: Nvision Xchange
text: Dr. Scott saved my life. Lou East

name: mandy reiter
text: I have used this practice for awhile and absolutely love my doctor, she is fantastic! The staff has had some turn overs and sometimes it is a pain to get refills but the quality of patient care is what is important and I am completely satisfied.

name: Dorothy Montgomery
text: This place is wonderful. They are very professional and friendly. I had addiction issues. Dr.Ram was very nice and non judgmental. He was very understanding about my addiction and worked with me. I can proudly say that I am sober for 3 years and I am a totally different person. Me and my family will always be very thankful to Dr.Ram and River Region Psychiatry.Thank you Dr.Ram......

name: Paul Brehm
text: They came highly recommended by a good friend, but I can’t speak to their services or staff because they quite literally never answer their phones or return your messages. Don’t waste your time here.

name: jennifer pilgrim
text: Horrible place. If you have anxiety don't go here they will make it worse. Especially the lady who handles the prescriptions.

name: Amber Worthington
text: Only people who have helped me. Very polite and professional... Just wish they were available to answer the phones during the day.

name: sarah taylor
text: My experience there was not good. The woman upfront has an attitude, if you need a medication refill the nurse will tell you the doctor is out of the office for a week, they will bill you for a charge your not responsible for, and once you see the doctor he doesn't communicate. He was actually yawning while I was talking and showed no interest in what I had to say. He would give me more medication than needed so I wouldn't have to come back so I just stopped going. Although I had insurance and didn't do anything to anyone I guess I wasn't interesting enough to receive treatment.

name: Shaneeda Staples
text: I had to edit my review because after dealing with them for a few years, this is what my experience is.(This review is for the main office on Sydney Curve.) They don't let you know when your doctor/therapist leaves your insurance network causing you to rack up a large bill. They've forgotten me more than once, letting others go back to see the doctor before I do. Back before the old office manager left, I asked them for over a year what's going on with my daughter's copays. I couldn't get a straight answer. Their billing department has been a hot mess. Saying one thing, doing another. They let a large bill rack up and now she can't see the doctor for her meds. The doctors/therapists are great but billing and the receptionists (except Quintella) are a disgrace to anyone in customer service. I'll be so glad when they're paid off. I don't recommend them to anyone. You've been warned...

name: Andrew Rolfsen
text:
This place never answers their phones, doesn't call when they cancel or reschedule your appointments, doesn't fill prescriptions on time and over bills all their clients. To say that their office manager is incompetent is to say the least.

I look for forward thinking doctors who have expanded on and are not limited to what they were initially taught. In particular, I look for one who works with kinesiology,  one who is particularly focused on the relationship between the muscles not only with the bones, but with each other and the energy relationship with other factors in our bodies and in our minds and surroundings.
I find Dr. Richard Aplin to be an open minded doctor and practitioner who can learn and grow and think outside the box in order to visualize what is happening within our bodies and respond with corrective/directive measures.
I find him to be the most effective chiropractor for my needs in this geographic area.

name: Lorren Bailey
text:
This is a long review but worth the read.

Dr. Aplin is an amazing doctor! He takes chiropractor care to levels no one has ever heard of in this town. Let's be real for a moment, almost every who's had pain at some point in their life has gone to a chiropractor for help. The standard way of thinking is that if you could just get that elbow to pop back or to have a hip or shoulder reset then all your pain would go away. But it never works, you might find some mild relief but it's usually short lived by a couple of hours to maybe days and then you wake up and say, you slept wrong and it's out again.

Well the team at Invision chiropractic care will teach you how to do address the underlying problems so you can fix it yourself in the long run. Yes you will get adjusted, yes it will probably hurt (Dr. Aplin has a different approach to adjusting that I've ever seen) but I'm a walking, breathing, significantly less pain and overall stress less person than when I walked into his office 4 months ago.

I'll be honest, I have a long history of surgeries to pains and only walked in to this office cause I didn't want to have another surgery and my dear friend suggested Dr. Aplin. I went when I truly didn't believe he was helping. I went when the pain spread to a neighboring body part. I went even though my TOC doc said I needed surgery to fix my problem. 4 months and I never missed an appointment. I can say today that I don't need surgery, my pain is gone and the results of becoming less stressed and worry free was worth more to me than the pain getting better.

BrainTap. Google it. Dr. Aplin introduced me to it and has changed my life because of it. I feel like I have the answer to a life long question that I know so many of us ask "How do I feel better?" yes that's generic but let's be honest, everyone is stressing about something these days. But after 4 months of using the BrainTap and doing my homework from Dr. Aplin, I do feel better, lighter able to take on what the world throws at me. It just works!!

resp.text: Lorren - you're a ROCKSTAR! Thanks for being a great patient and showing what you can achieve through commitment and prioritizing your health. We're thankful for you!

Dr Blandchard has a special knack for allowing the client to relax and give total surrender to his way of asking questions and getting to the bottom of the real issues and then develop a plan to resolve these issues one at a time in such a way that the client does not feel intimidated. The sta dr Blandchard has a special knack for allowing the client to relax and give total surrender to his way of asking questions getting to the bottom of the real issues and then develop a plan to resolve these issues one at a time in such a way that the client does not feel intimidated. I have total confidence in Dr Blandchard in everything that he does, he is a very strong  Community leader. Dr Blandchard never makes you feel small or unimportant or that your issues are trivial. name: TOM JUNGKIND
text: After 4 sessions with my 14yr old daughter, I requested a phone call to discuss her progress. I was essentially told that I wasn't privileged to any info without my 14yr [ minor] old's "permission". Had this therapist, and that's the limit of her  professional credentials, been more willing to discuss my minor daughters treatment, we might not be looking elsewhere for help!

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about your experience and we are very sorry to hear you were not satisfied with our services.  IHS is committed to following all federal and state laws/regulations.  In the state of Alabama, a fourteen-year-old is given the right to consent to treatment which means it is up to them on what information is disclosed.  While this may seem unfair and may not make sense, we are obligated to follow all federal and state regulations.

name: Sean Bailey
text: Kayla is awesome! She has helped me navigate some really challenging times, and I am so grateful.

name: Hillary w
text: Michelle has been a godsend. I don't know that we would have made it without her. She is open to working with unusual problems and is very knowledgeable about the lgbtq population. The techniques I learned were very helpful and she had been great at helping us keep on the right path.

name: Jennifer Veitch
text: I have worked with and known Michelle Knight for over a decade. She truly cares for others and the community. Her genuine helping spirit makes it easy to talk to her. She empowers others, is knowledgeable about different theories/approaches to helping, communicates well, and listens effectively! I highly recommend Integrated Health Services!

name: Winnie Luna
text: Their response to my last review (from Lola) was that they would make exceptions due to illness.... We were Ill and getting tested for COVID. They still not have made this right. I had to make another review because I could not respond to their response. Just know if you are sick during a pandemic, they will still steal your money.

name: Alexandra Traviss
text: Michelle deeply cares about her clients, has tremendous empathy, and is a truly professional counselor.

name: Abbey Mitchell
text: Michelle is very professional and seems to really care about her work and her clients!

name: L K
text:
She values money over her client’s wellbeing. I missed one appointment for extenuating circumstances, and my credit card was charged $140. I very nicely asked for one grace period, and I was vulnerable to her about my situation. She said I could do a payment plan, and I agreed. I also emailed her though that I would prefer to find another therapist that cares more about their patient’s wellbeing over money considering there is a global pandemic, and everyone is struggling. Since then, she has not responded to my emails in order to help get the charge off my credit card for the payment plan.

Part of working with people who are working on themselves should be showing grace in times of need.

resp.text: Integrative Health Services, LLC requires every client to sign an agreement stating they understand they will be charged for a no show or a later cancellation. We allow up to a twenty four hour notice for cancellations. Our policy also notes exceptions for medical issues such as being sick where we excuse a no show or late cancel but the client must meet the requirements for this as outlined in the policy. We want every client to be happy with our services and we give everyone the opportunity to decline working with us if they disagree with our no show late cancellation policy.

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text: I love my counselor! I'm a mess emotionally (and physically for that matter) but she never makes me feel that way. I dread going, but I'm always glad I do. I always feel better when I leave. I hope to be better one day. So nice to find the "right" fit. You know who you are...Thank you, thank you, thank you! 😉 *FYI- The AAWA is in the bldg in the very back, not sure if they still have any offices in that front bldg that is listed on here as being part of them. That bldg is mostly other businesses.*

name: Janson Ray
text: In my opinion, this place is better than the Opelika mental health facility... they helped turn my life around.. Thanks Dr. Rowe and Mr. Jim.

name: Shatel Jackson
text: This is a picture of Valley Haven. EAMH (Alsobrook Ctr) is next door. EAMH has helped me beyond words. They are still helping me. If you or anyone you know need mental health PLEASE call Ms. Luann for an appointment. ASAP!!!

name: Billy Traylor
text: Good service, but you'll wait somedays

name: Hollow One
text:
Dr. Dryer shouldnt be an employee at this facility. She should be a patient. And she should get help in learning how to feel empathy for her fellow human beings. How to stop hiding behind her screen and nurse dude and be honest instead of lashing out in the worst way. She should learn how to regain trust in other people, no matter how much they scare her.

You cant help heal others until you heal yourself.
And if this is a case of her feeling burnt out, she needs to be honest, with herself and others.

You failed me. Dont fail others unnecessarily.

When you hurt someone that is relying on you for help and healing, reflect on your actions, learn from it, and dont let your guilt gnaw on you from the inside forever like mine has me. Know peace, know health, know healing.

I suffered from an undeserved sense of guilt for things I hadnt even done or said and I can tell you its not a fun place to be.
When you added to my struggles, it hurt me so much. Ive never felt so betrayed in my life and Ive been through a lot.

The position youre in, you could help a lot of people. You could do so much good.
Ive lost faith in the system because of this ordeal, but others havent. Be there for them rather than jumping to conclusions about them. There are a lot of people that need and deserve sincere empathy and if you cant do that for them then youre definitely in the wrong line of work.

name: Brian Browning
text:
I am a current patient with MAMHA. I have a phone appointment almost every month with Dr Dryer and am overall unsatisfied with my care. She strictly goes by a symptom check list to just prescribe, and guess,  what is going on with me, there is no personal relationship. Every time I talk to her it's as if I have never been treated by her before. This leads to many problems such as her being adamant to prescribe medications for me even if I have taken them unsuccessfully in the past. I understand she is most likely burnt out so I feel for her. But this is my livelihood I'm talking about here. I need someone who will investigate further into my mental illness in order to get an accurate diagnosis and have an effective treatment plan. Our phone conversations are rushed and can sometimes be over in less than 5 mins. I find this very unprofessional and personally disrespectful.

I also spent a few weeks in their Residential Crisis Unit on Beth manor Drive. When I say it was literal hell, I mean it. The techs were very unproffesional and I'm pretty sure one of them brought a gun into the unit. At the time I was very likely to outbursts because I was in crisis but they never liked giving me emergency medication causing my Chao to ice crises to become worse leading to an even greater outburst. I felt out of control and they were incapable of doing their jobs to help comfort me. They would often talk about murder and how they know how to get away with it of they had to. I had the feeling that most of the staff were in some type of gang and it's very possible they were criminals. I'm saying this based on exposure to their words and actions.  Thecook, David(worst of them all) is a literal sociopath. Cold, cool, and cunning yet extremely vile and subtly manipulative. On his left hand he has his flesh carved down some ways down his fingers and his bones poke out in sharpened tips, I'm certain he uses it as a weapon. It was the most disgusting body mutilation I have ever come across. I am also positive that he was putting toilet water in our food and we were served some kind of mystery meat routinely, always looked different. But I didn't know what it was, they said it was chicken but was clearly not. I think it was roadkill or most likely human flesh. They were,after all, a part of a demonic cult of cannibals that prey on the weak and vulnerable. David once threatened to kill me! How could you do that to someone with a debilitating mental illness, in crisis, trying to get help? ,They need to close this place down. Plain and simple.
The standing psychiatrist here is horrible as well. She quickly gets defensive and is unusually aggressive. Its like she is mad at us patients for no particular reason.
The facility is unbelievably small and cramp. This led to an extreme feeling of claustrophobia I experienced the entire time I was there. The place was also very dirty. The walls were caked in God knows what and one window was covered in shot or spit and they never even acknowledged it! To them we were the vulnerable people that were less than them and therefore they treated us inhumanely. I felt like a piece of trash.

My post sounds crazy and that's because it is. But very real. I really want this place shut down after my experience there.  Which by the way, resulted in me escaping out of a window. I was literally convinced they were going to take me to a remote location where they would tie me down and slowly carve out my flesh to feed off of. But they would have kept me alive for a very long time, occasionally feeding me my own flesh while they slowly tortured me. I have PTSD from this place fr fr..
I refused to go back to Beth Manor so they took me to another crisis center.  I get it I'm crazy. But there are dark forces in this world that mostly go unnoticed by the common man. I happened to experience some of the darkest most evil place in the world for some reason. I haven't been the same since my stay here. So traumatic.
Please don't ever send your loved one or yourself to this hellish dungean of pain.

name: theink22
text: I would not recommend this place to no one . It is alot of illegal activity happening in this job from incorrect billing to pressures of productivity. The individuals that are working in this job and will not leave their position and are continously being MESSY and leading other to be feeling harrassed in their positions . The COVID-19 procedures are not being met with little supplies and precautiions . This Mental health facility is horrible . .. they do not give continous financial incentives as needed . This is a one-sidded type of job . it is a unfair work enviroment .

resp.text:
Hello,
Please contact us if you are aware of anything that is happening that is not following policy or standards.   You may contact our agency at (334) 279-7830 and you will be routed to the proper department to address your concern.  Any time there are concerns such as these, staff are encouraged to route those concerns through the proper channels.  That way, we can address any issues.  If we don't know what the issues are, we cannot resolve them!   We take all employment, safety measures, and allegations of illegal activity very seriously.
Thank you,
Donna Leslie
Executive Director
Montgomery Area Mental Health Authority

name: Meredith Duke
text:
I would HIGHLY suggest going somewhere else!!
Even if you have to pay out of pocket to go somewhere else then do it! This place is enough to drive someone who has no mental health issues insane!

My husband was released from Crossbridge 3 months ago & just now had his first physician appointment. When released from Crossbridge he was released under this offices care & was told to follow his mental health regimen to get better. His first doctors appointment no one called him & when he called to find out what happened he was told that the doctor called out for the day & they forgot to call & tell the patients so they set his appointment out another month. The next appointment he didn’t realize his phone was on silent, called the clinic right back to let them know & instead of letting him speak to a doctor that day they set it off another month. His appointment today the doctor (Dr. Dryer) tells him she can’t change any of his medications because his anxiety medication isn’t working neither is his depression medication. He also asked to get his craving medications for alcohol refilled & she told him she couldn’t do it because she didn’t know what medication it was that he was on. This place is absolutely insane! He calls back to the office to let them know the medication stays on hold for 30 minutes for the receptionist to answer & transfer him to a voicemail that has a full mailbox and he couldn’t even leave a message!! This place should be shut down! They do no good in helping people with mental health issues but further hindering them. My husband has relapsed several times since being released from Crossbridge & cries out for help so much but can’t seem to get any. Absolutely DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE WHATSOEVER! If I could give negative stars I would! Makes me wonder how many have taken their lives due to the lack of empathy, disorganization & downright unprofessionalism of this place because this place displays the exact opposite of mental health advocacy.

text: I’ve been trying to get paperwork from them for about four months now and the reps are rude the people don’t wanna do their job they never call back I’m so tired of calling them so much of a headache

Mr. Amos, I am sorry that you were disconnected while trying to make an intake appointment. We have change a lot since April and if you call for an intake appointment now, we will get your profile entered into our system and you can come for the intake Monday - Friday at 8:00 a.m. or 1:00 p.m. for the intake. We are currently doing six intakes every morning and four intakes every afternoon. It is on a first come basis. I hope you will give us another chance.

Henry E. parker
Executive Director
